Program name: Minor in Biology-Behavior and Society

description: The minor in biomedical engineering provides students with a fundamental understanding of engineering principles as they apply to human health and disease. Biomedical engineering encompasses a broad range of activities, including the design of medical instruments, artificial organs, and prostheses; the development of new diagnostic and therapeutic techniques; and research into the biomechanics of physiological systems. Students completing the minor will gain exposure to at least three of the following areas: biomechanics, biomaterials, biomedical imaging, medical instrumentation, cellular and tissue engineering, and systems physiology. The minor is flexible, allowing students to tailor their coursework to their interests, and can be easily combined with any undergraduate major.
Program name: Minor in Biomedical Engineering

description: The biomedical science and technology minor at Clarkson University allows undergraduate students with interests in healthcare, medicine and human health to acquire knowledge in biomedical sciences and technology that will prepare them for further studies in medical school or graduate programs, or for careers in the medical device, biomedical and biotechnology industries. This minor is open to all majors, but is particularly applicable to students in engineering, chemistry and biology. The minor is offered by the Department of Biomedical Engineering and consists of a minimum of 15 credits. Students must have a GPA of at least 2.0 in the courses used to satisfy the minor requirements. Specific course requirements are determined with the minor adviser.
Program name: Minor in Biomedical Science and Technology

description: The biomolecular engineering concentration allows students interested in the life sciences to apply chemical engineering fundamentals to solve biological problems. Students can focus on topics such as the development of biomaterials, bioprocess design, drug delivery systems and tissue engineering. They may pursue careers in industries related to biotechnology, pharmaceuticals, food and agriculture, and medicine or pursue graduate studies in biomolecular engineering, biomedical engineering, or other life science-related disciplines.
Accreditation status: The Chemical Engineering, BS program is accredited by the Engineering Accreditation Commission of ABET, https://www.abet.org.
Program name: Concentration in Biomolecular Engineering

description: This program at Clarkson University focuses on understanding the molecular basis of biological processes and diseases. Students explore topics such as biochemistry, genetics, cell biology, and molecular pharmacology. The curriculum combines theoretical knowledge with hands-on laboratory experience, preparing students for careers in research, biotechnology, pharmaceuticals, and healthcare.
Program name: Bachelor of Science in Biomolecular Science

description: A minor in business will provide you with a solid foundation in the principles of business, including accounting, finance, management, marketing and operations. No matter what your major, a business minor can enhance your career opportunities, give you the option to pursue a Master of Business Administration (MBA) or help you start your own business. With a business minor at Clarkson, you will broaden your career prospects by combining your specialized skills with business knowledge to open up a wider range of job opportunities. You will become a well-rounded professional, gaining a holistic understanding of how businesses operate, improving your decision-making and problem-solving abilities. You will also develop leadership and entrepreneurship skills to manage projects, lead teams and innovate. A business minor can be a valuable stepping stone toward an MBA, providing you with a strong academic foundation, and you will have networking opportunities to connect with business professionals, faculty, and peers, expanding your network. In the business minor, you will learn about Accounting, Finance, Management, Marketing, and Operations Management.
Program name: Minor in Business

description: Business Administration is the broadest and most flexible major in the Reh School of Business, allowing students to combine a foundational business core with coursework from a variety of business fields or other disciplines at Clarkson. Students majoring in Business Administration at Clarkson can choose to declare a concentration in one of the eight business fields, including accounting, digital marketing, economics, entrepreneurship, financial information and analysis, global supply chain management, innovation and entrepreneurship, or human resource management. Many students also pursue a minor or a double major in one of Clarkson’s non-business fields. The Business Administration major is ideal for students with strong communication, problem-solving, and analytical skills and an interest in applying these skills across a variety of business functions.
Accreditation status: Accredited by AACSB International (The Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business)
Program name: Bachelor of Science in Business Administration

description: Data is everywhere, and businesses are collecting more and more of it every day. But having data isn’t enough. To be useful, data must be interpreted and applied to make better decisions. The Business Analytics program at Clarkson University provides students with the critical skills needed to analyze data, identify trends, and develop strategies that lead to success. From uncovering valuable insights to optimizing business operations, Business Analytics professionals are essential for any organization to thrive in today’s data-driven economy. As a Business Analytics major, you’ll dive into a curriculum that blends quantitative methods, computer science, and business knowledge. You will learn to use analytical tools, develop predictive models, and communicate data-driven insights effectively. This interdisciplinary approach ensures you are well-equipped to tackle complex business challenges and drive strategic decisions across various industries. Real-World Projects: Work on projects that simulate real business challenges, applying your analytical skills to practical problems. Industry Partnerships: Benefit from our strong connections with leading companies, offering internship and career opportunities. Expert Faculty: Learn from professors who are not only experts in their fields but also dedicated mentors committed to your success. State-of-the-Art Tools: Gain hands-on experience with the latest analytics software and technologies used in the industry. Career-Focused Curriculum: Our program is designed to prepare you for high-demand roles in data analytics, business intelligence, consulting, and more.
Program name: Bachelor of Science in Business Analytics

description: The Bachelor of Science degree in Business of Biotechnology provides students with the foundational scientific knowledge (biology, chemistry, and physics) and essential business skills to succeed in the rapidly growing biotechnology industry. Students will acquire a strong understanding of the biotechnology ecosystem, including research and development, intellectual property, regulatory affairs, manufacturing, and commercialization strategies. Graduates will be prepared for a variety of roles in the biotechnology sector, including product development, marketing, sales, business development, regulatory affairs, and project management. This interdisciplinary program integrates coursework from biology, chemistry, business, and liberal arts, ensuring a well-rounded education. Our strong emphasis on experiential learning, including internships, co-ops, and research opportunities, provides students with practical, real-world experience.
Program name: Bachelor's Degree in Business of Biotechnology

description: Clarkson University's Bachelor of Science (BS) in Business Administration major prepares students for successful careers in business across various industries and roles. Students gain a strong foundation in core business functions, including accounting, finance, marketing, management and operations. The program emphasizes critical thinking, problem-solving, communication and teamwork, equipping graduates with the skills necessary to adapt to an evolving global business landscape. Students can choose from nine concentrations: Accounting, Business Analytics, Entrepreneurship & Innovation, Financial Information & Analysis, Global Business, Information Systems & Business Processes, Innovation & Supply Chain Management, Marketing and Sustainability in Business. This flexibility allows students to tailor their studies to their interests and career aspirations. With a focus on real-world application, students engage in experiential learning opportunities, such as internships, case competitions and capstone projects, preparing them to make an immediate impact upon graduation.
Accreditation status: The Business Programs are accredited by AACSB International, The Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business.
Program name: Bachelor of Science in Business Studies

description: With a concentration in business intelligence and data analytics, you will be prepared to tackle the burgeoning field of information management, an area of high demand across all industries. You will become fluent in the techniques and technologies necessary to collect, organize, analyze, visualize and interpret complex data and extract meaningful insights.
Program name: Concentration in Business Intelligence and Data Analytics

description: Chemical engineering is a diverse and dynamic field that applies principles from chemistry, biology, physics and math to design, develop and operate processes that transform raw materials into valuable products. From energy and environmental solutions to pharmaceuticals and advanced materials, chemical engineers are at the forefront of innovation, tackling some of the world’s most pressing challenges. As a chemical engineering student at Clarkson University, you will delve into topics such as thermodynamics, fluid mechanics, heat and mass transfer, reaction kinetics, and process control. You will gain expertise in problem-solving, critical thinking and design through hands-on laboratory experiences, computational modeling and real-world projects. Our curriculum is designed to provide you with a strong theoretical foundation and practical skills, preparing you for a wide range of career opportunities or for graduate studies.
Accreditation status: The undergraduate engineering programs in aerospace engineering, chemical engineering, civil engineering, computer engineering, electrical engineering, environmental engineering, mechanical engineering, and software engineering at Clarkson University are accredited by the Engineering Accreditation Commission of ABET, www.abet.org.
Program name: Bachelor of Science in Chemical Engineering

description: As an undergraduate chemistry major at Clarkson, you will engage in a hands-on, research-driven program that blends theoretical knowledge with practical application. You will have the opportunity to work closely with faculty mentors, utilizing state-of-the-art instrumentation to explore chemical phenomena and contribute to cutting-edge research. Our curriculum emphasizes a strong foundation in all areas of chemistry, preparing you for diverse career paths in industry, academia and government, as well as for further graduate or professional studies. Our chemistry curriculum offers a rigorous, hands-on experience covering the main fields of chemistry, including analytical, inorganic, organic and physical chemistry. As you progress, you will have the opportunity to delve deeper into these subjects, exploring advanced topics like spectroscopy, quantum chemistry, computational chemistry, environmental chemistry, polymer chemistry and biochemistry. You can also specialize through elective courses in areas such as forensic chemistry and materials chemistry.
Program name: Bachelor of Science in Chemistry
Minor in Chemistry

description: Civil engineers play a vital role in our society. They design, construct, manage and maintain essential infrastructure and services, including roads, bridges, buildings, water supply systems, waste treatment facilities and more. At Clarkson, our civil engineering curriculum provides a strong foundation in a variety of areas. We combine classroom learning with hands-on experience, including laboratory work, fieldwork and senior design projects. Our program is structured to prepare you for diverse career paths, whether you plan to work in consulting, government, construction or research. You’ll develop strong analytical skills, problem-solving abilities and an understanding of the ethical and societal responsibilities of a civil engineer. Clarkson’s civil engineering program offers a rich and rewarding educational experience, equipping you with the skills and knowledge to address complex challenges and make a positive impact on the world.
Accreditation status: Accredited by the Engineering Accreditation Commission of ABET
Program name: Bachelor of Science in Civil Engineering

description: The cognitive neuroscience minor is intended for students who wish to pursue careers or graduate work in cognitive neuroscience or related fields. The minor combines the fields of psychology, biology, and computational science to investigate the neural mechanisms underlying thought, emotion, and behavior.
Program name: Minor in Cognitive Neuroscience
Major in Communication

description: A minor in communication provides students with the critical thinking, communication and problem-solving skills necessary to be effective and responsible communicators. Students will gain a better understanding of how people communicate with one another through various forms of media, as well as the societal implications of different types of communication. This minor is ideal for any student who desires to improve their understanding and ability to communicate clearly and persuasively within an increasingly complex and interconnected world.
Program name: Minor in Communication

description: The Financial Information & Analysis (FIA) major is offered within Clarkson's Reh School of Business. It provides a strong foundation for a variety of careers in financial services, financial advising, and corporate financial management functions. It also provides the foundation for those students wishing to pursue their CPA. FIA students take a common core of business courses and then complete an advanced sequence of courses in their chosen concentration in Accounting, Financial Management, or Investment Management. Our graduates find careers in a wide range of industries and positions related to finance or accounting.
Accreditation status: Clarkson's Reh School of Business is accredited by AACSB International – the Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business. AACSB accreditation is the hallmark of excellence in business education, and has been earned by less than five percent of the world's business programs.
Program name: Bachelor of Science in Accounting

description: The American Studies Program is an interdisciplinary undergraduate major that allows students to study the United States and its cultures from multiple perspectives, including anthropology, economics, history, literature, philosophy, political science, and sociology. As an interdisciplinary field, American Studies focuses on the intersections of various perspectives on American culture and society, rather than on the isolated study of particular disciplines. Students are encouraged to pursue their own interests and to fashion their own area of concentration within American studies, whether that is the study of a particular social issue, a historical period, or a cultural topic. The program allows students to combine a broad liberal arts education with skills that are highly valued by employers, including critical thinking, research, and communication. Graduates of the American Studies program are prepared for a wide variety of career options, including law, education, public service, journalism, marketing, and the arts, as well as for graduate study in fields such as law, history, literature, and American studies.
Program name: Bachelor of Arts in American/United States Studies/Civilization
Bachelor of Arts in Animation, Video Graphics and Special Effects
Bachelor of Science in Anthropology

description: The Bachelor of Science in Architectural and Facilities Engineering (AFE) degree is offered through the Wallace H. Coulter School of Engineering. This interdisciplinary program is designed to create engineers who understand the entire building life cycle, including design, construction, operation and renewal of high-performance buildings and facilities. Architectural and facilities engineers are involved in the planning, design, construction, operation, maintenance and decommissioning of systems for both new and existing buildings. At Clarkson, students are exposed to all phases of building development as they learn to address challenges such as energy efficiency, sustainability and smart infrastructure. Our graduates are equipped to work in consulting engineering firms, architectural firms, construction companies, manufacturing companies and governmental agencies. Many go on to work as facilities managers for large corporations, institutions and governments.
Accreditation status: The Bachelor of Science in Architectural and Facilities Engineering (AFE) program is accredited by the Engineering Accreditation Commission of ABET, https://www.abet.org.
Program name: Bachelor of Science in Architectural and Facilities Engineering

description: The BMB program at Clarkson emphasizes interdisciplinary training and research experiences in both biochemistry and molecular biology. Students gain a fundamental understanding of chemical and physical principles underlying life processes, as well as the application of experimental and computational approaches to studying biological systems at the molecular and cellular levels. Our curriculum provides students with a strong foundation in chemistry, biology, mathematics, and physics, along with advanced coursework in areas such as biochemistry, molecular genetics, cell biology, bioinformatics, and structural biology. Students have opportunities to participate in cutting-edge research alongside faculty mentors, both during the academic year and through summer research programs. The BMB program prepares graduates for a wide range of career paths, including research and development in biotechnology and pharmaceutical industries, healthcare professions, academic research, and graduate studies in biochemistry, molecular biology, genetics, or related fields.
Program name: Bachelor of Science in Biochemistry and Molecular Biology

description: Biomedical engineers combine a wide range of analytical skills with an understanding of human biology to solve problems at the interface of engineering and medicine. The Bachelor of Science in biomedical engineering (BSBME) program at Clarkson University provides a comprehensive curriculum that integrates biological sciences with classical engineering principles. You will learn to design medical devices and systems, develop new diagnostic and therapeutic techniques, and conduct research that improves human health.
Accreditation status: Clarkson University’s Bachelor of Science in Biomedical Engineering program is accredited by the Engineering Accreditation Commission of ABET, www.abet.org.
Program name: Bachelor of Science in Biomedical Engineering

description: As a Biomedical Science and Technology major at Clarkson, you'll delve into the fascinating world where engineering principles meet biological systems and medical applications. You'll gain a comprehensive understanding of human health and disease, while also developing the problem-solving and critical thinking skills essential for innovation in the medical field. This truly interdisciplinary field applies the principles of engineering and physical sciences to biology, medicine, and healthcare. Our program is designed to provide a strong foundation in both the life sciences and engineering, preparing you for a wide range of careers in healthcare, biotechnology, research, and medicine. You'll engage in hands-on learning experiences, collaborate with faculty on cutting-edge research, and develop the entrepreneurial mindset needed to translate scientific discoveries into real-world solutions. Our graduates go on to careers in research and development, biotechnology, pharmaceutical, medical device industries, or medical school and other health professions.
Program name: Bachelor of Science in Biomedical Science and Technology

description: Biomolecular engineering is an interdisciplinary field that applies engineering principles to biological systems. Students will learn how to design, analyze and manipulate biological materials and systems for applications in medicine, biotechnology, energy, and environmental sustainability. Biomolecular engineers work at the intersection of biology, chemistry, physics, mathematics, and engineering, developing innovative solutions to complex problems related to human health, agriculture, and industry. In the biomolecular engineering program, you will develop a strong foundation in chemical engineering principles, molecular biology, biochemistry, and biophysics. You will learn to apply these principles to solve problems related to drug delivery, tissue engineering, biomanufacturing, and biofuels. The program emphasizes hands-on laboratory experience, computational modeling, and design projects, preparing students for careers in research, development, and production in various industries.
Program name: Bachelor of Science in Biomolecular Engineering

description: Clarkson's interdisciplinary bioscience and technology program is designed to provide you with the fundamental knowledge and skills needed to tackle the challenges of modern bioscience, including environmental sciences, biotechnology, and health-related fields. This program is for students who want to apply a cross-disciplinary approach to solving problems in biology, chemistry, and engineering. It is a comprehensive and unique program that provides the flexibility to tailor your education to your specific interests and career goals. You can choose from concentrations in Biotechnology, Environmental Science & Policy, or Pre-Health. The program provides the necessary background for entry into graduate school (MS, PhD) or professional schools (medical, dental, veterinary, pharmacy, physical therapy, optometry, public health) and for direct entry into the job market. This program is offered by the Institute for a Sustainable Environment and the Department of Biology.
Program name: Bachelor of Science in Bioscience and Technology, Interdisciplinary

Concentration name: Digital Business, Financial Information & Analysis, Global Supply Chain Management, Innovation & Entrepreneurship, Marketing
description: Clarkson's Bachelor of Science in Business program helps students develop the critical skills and knowledge needed to succeed in today’s dynamic business world. The program emphasizes innovative thinking, data-driven decision-making, and strong leadership, preparing graduates for diverse roles across industries. Our curriculum provides a solid foundation in core business principles while offering flexibility for students to specialize in areas of interest. You’ll gain hands-on experience through internships, projects, and case studies, connecting classroom learning to real-world challenges. With a strong focus on career readiness, Clarkson Business graduates are highly sought after by top companies and organizations.
Accreditation status: Accredited by AACSB International (The Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business). AACSB accreditation is the hallmark of excellence in business education.
Program name: Bachelor of Science in Business

description: Materials Engineering is a new and rapidly growing field concerned with the discovery and design of new materials. Materials engineers focus on the discovery, characterization, development, and processing of materials for use in a wide variety of applications. This minor is open to students in all engineering disciplines, but it may also be pursued by students in other STEM fields (e.g., Physics, Chemistry). In all cases, the student must have sufficient preparation in mathematics and science to be able to complete the coursework. The Materials Engineering Minor requires the completion of 18 credits in specific courses.
Program name: Minor in Materials Engineering

description: The Bachelor of Science in Business Intelligence and Data Analytics (BScBIA) programme aims to equip students with strong business knowledge, analytical skills, and hands-on experience in business intelligence and data analytics tools and techniques. The programme curriculum integrates interdisciplinary knowledge from business, computer science, and statistics to cultivate students’ ability to analyze business problems, extract insights from data, and provide data-driven solutions to business challenges. Upon completion of the programme, students should be able to: 1. Apply knowledge of business, computer science, and statistics to analyze complex business problems involving data. 2. Formulate and solve real-world business problems by utilizing appropriate business intelligence and data analytics tools and techniques. 3. Critically evaluate and interpret data-driven insights to make informed business decisions. 4. Communicate effectively with diverse stakeholders on data analytics findings and implications. 5. Demonstrate ethical awareness and social responsibility in the collection, analysis, and use of data.
Program name: Bachelor in Business Intelligence and Data Analytics

description: At Clarkson, our bachelor of science in engineering & management (E&M) program produces exceptional leaders and innovators. This interdisciplinary program is designed for students who want to combine a strong background in engineering with business and management principles. You will learn how to design, implement and improve complex systems, processes and products, while also developing the leadership, communication and problem-solving skills needed to succeed in today's dynamic global marketplace. The E&M program is designed to develop critical thinkers who can bridge the gap between technical and business functions within an organization. Students in the program gain a solid understanding of engineering principles, business strategy, operations, finance and marketing. They learn to analyze data, make informed decisions and lead teams effectively. This makes them highly sought-after by employers in a wide range of industries, from manufacturing and technology to consulting and entrepreneurship.
Program name: Bachelor of Science in Engineering and Management

description: If you are someone who is analytical, goal-oriented and enjoys solving problems, then a major in financial information and analysis (FIA) at Clarkson University is the right fit for you. FIA students learn to evaluate the financial performance of corporations, manage portfolios of stocks, bonds and other financial assets, and analyze financial and economic data to make sound business decisions. Our FIA program prepares students for successful careers in investment management, corporate finance, financial planning, commercial banking, risk management and insurance, and FinTech. Some of the careers our graduates pursue include financial analysts, investment bankers, portfolio managers, financial planners, risk analysts and consultants. Through hands-on learning experiences, FIA students use real data, software and tools to develop strong analytical and financial skills. Additionally, students have the opportunity to earn professional certifications such as the CFA (Chartered Financial Analyst) and the CFP (Certified Financial Planner) after graduation. Clarkson FIA graduates are highly sought after by employers due to their strong analytical and problem-solving skills, and their ability to apply classroom knowledge to real-world financial issues.
Accreditation status: The Reh School of Business is accredited by AACSB International (The Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business).
Program name: Bachelor of Science in Finance

description: Our Bachelor of Science (BS) in Financial Information and Analysis blends fundamental business, economic, and finance principles with data analysis and information technology. Our curriculum prepares students for careers in financial services by combining strong analytical and technical skills with an understanding of financial markets, products, and institutions. This interdisciplinary program gives students an in-depth understanding of the financial services industry, financial instruments, and financial markets, along with the ability to use data analysis tools and techniques to evaluate investment opportunities and manage risk. This combination of skills prepares graduates for a wide range of careers in financial analysis, portfolio management, risk management, and financial technology. Students in the financial information and analysis program learn to: interpret financial information and apply it to decision-making; apply analytical tools to financial data; work with databases and financial software; understand the regulatory and ethical environment of financial markets; and develop communication and teamwork skills necessary for success in the financial industry.
Program name: Bachelor of Science in Financial Information and Analysis

description: Global supply chains are at the heart of how businesses get products and services to customers. Supply chain professionals manage the flow of goods and services, from sourcing raw materials to delivering the final product. Today’s global supply chains are complex and dynamic, requiring professionals who can analyze data, optimize processes, and make strategic decisions. The Global Supply Chain Management (BS) program at Clarkson University prepares you to become a leader in this critical field. You’ll gain a deep understanding of supply chain principles, logistics, operations management, and strategic sourcing. Our curriculum emphasizes data analytics, technology, and sustainability, ensuring you're ready to tackle the challenges of modern supply chains. You’ll also develop strong problem-solving, communication, and leadership skills, essential for success in any organization.
Program name: Bachelor of Science in Global Supply Chain Management

description: What does it take to launch a business? Creativity, drive and the ability to find and solve problems through innovative solutions. At Clarkson, we foster your entrepreneurial spirit to tackle real-world challenges through our hands-on, project-based Innovation and Entrepreneurship program. Learn to develop, launch and lead new ventures in the private, public or nonprofit sectors. With a bachelor's degree in innovation and entrepreneurship, you will graduate with the skills to discover and evaluate market opportunities, lead and manage innovative projects, develop business models and strategies, secure funding and resources, and effectively communicate your vision. Our bachelor's degree in innovation and entrepreneurship focuses on helping you develop the skills to be a successful leader who can drive change and create value. Through courses like Creativity, Innovation and Design Thinking, Engineering, Entrepreneurship and Society, Social Entrepreneurship, and Supply Chain Management, you’ll gain real-world knowledge on how to develop, launch, and lead a new venture. Through this interdisciplinary program, you will develop the critical thinking skills to analyze problems, identify opportunities, and create innovative solutions. Our program emphasizes hands-on learning, where you’ll work on projects that challenge you to apply your knowledge and skills to real-world problems. You’ll also have opportunities to collaborate with other students, faculty, and industry professionals, giving you valuable networking experience and exposure to different perspectives.
Program name: Bachelor of Science in Innovation and Entrepreneurship

description: Computer engineers blend electrical engineering and computer science to design and build complex computer systems, ranging from tiny embedded controllers to large-scale supercomputers and global networks. You will learn to design hardware, write software, and integrate these components to create innovative technology. At Clarkson, our computer engineering students enjoy hands-on learning, collaborating with faculty on research and design projects. The department's comprehensive curriculum emphasizes both theoretical foundations and practical applications, preparing graduates for diverse roles in industry and academia. We offer a strong foundation in digital system design, computer architecture, embedded systems, networks, and software engineering. You can further specialize through electives in areas like artificial intelligence, machine learning, robotics, and cybersecurity.
Accreditation status: Accredited by the Engineering Accreditation Commission of ABET
Program name: Bachelor of Science in Computer Engineering
Bachelor of Science in Electrical Engineering

Concentration name: biomolecular engineering, chemical engineering, civil engineering, computer engineering, electrical engineering, environmental engineering, mechanical engineering, software engineering
description: The Engineering Studies BS is a customizable, multidisciplinary, design-oriented program that allows students to tailor their engineering education to their unique interests and career goals. Students will take fundamental engineering courses, learn hands-on design principles, and then specialize in an area of their choosing. The program offers maximum flexibility, allowing students to design their curriculum with the help of a faculty advisor. It provides a broad foundation in engineering, along with specific expertise, preparing graduates for diverse roles in industry, entrepreneurship, or further graduate studies.
Accreditation status: Clarkson's Bachelor of Science in Engineering Studies is NOT accredited by the Engineering Accreditation Commission of ABET.
Program name: Bachelor in Engineering Studies

description: Environmental engineers solve problems at the intersection of human activity and the environment. They play a vital role in protecting human health and the environment for future generations. Environmental engineering graduates are in high demand across many sectors of society. They work in consulting, industry, government agencies and non-profits on challenges such as: providing safe drinking water; treating wastewater; mitigating air pollution; managing solid waste; cleaning up hazardous waste sites; designing sustainable energy systems; and addressing climate change. The Environmental Engineering program at Clarkson prepares students with the fundamental engineering and scientific knowledge to address these complex challenges. The curriculum includes a strong foundation in chemistry, physics, mathematics, engineering sciences, and environmental science. Students learn to apply engineering principles to design and implement sustainable solutions. The program emphasizes hands-on learning, problem-solving, and teamwork through laboratory experiences, design projects, and fieldwork. Graduates are prepared for professional practice, graduate studies, and leadership roles in addressing global environmental challenges.
Accreditation status: The Environmental Engineering program is accredited by the Engineering Accreditation Commission of ABET, https://www.abet.org.
Program name: Bachelor of Science in Environmental Engineering

description: Mechanical engineers play a critical role in almost every industry, impacting the world in ways that include sustainable energy, health and medicine, manufacturing, national defense, and transportation. You will learn the fundamentals of engineering science, including statics, dynamics, solid mechanics, fluid mechanics, thermodynamics, heat transfer, and mechanical design. With a BS in Mechanical Engineering from Clarkson, you'll be well-prepared to solve problems and create innovative designs for the 21st century across a wide range of industries and technologies.
Accreditation status: The Bachelor of Science in Mechanical Engineering program is accredited by the Engineering Accreditation Commission of ABET, https://www.abet.org.
Program name: Bachelor of Science in Mechanical Engineering

description: Mathematics at Clarkson will challenge your intellect and empower you to solve complex problems by connecting theory and application. You'll gain a deep understanding of mathematical concepts and how to apply them to real-world challenges in various fields, including science, engineering, business and technology. Clarkson’s Bachelor of Science in mathematics allows you to tailor your education to your interests and career goals. Whether you’re interested in theoretical mathematics, applied mathematics, statistics, data science or other areas, our flexible curriculum and dedicated faculty will help you achieve your goals.
Program name: Bachelor of Science in Mathematics

description: The Bachelor of Science (BS) in physics program at Clarkson University will give you a strong foundation in physics and an understanding of how physics relates to other fields of science and engineering. Physics is an incredibly versatile major that opens doors to a wide array of career options. As a physics major, you'll gain expertise in critical thinking, problem-solving and quantitative analysis, and you'll develop communication skills to clearly convey complex ideas. As a student in Clarkson's physics BS program, you'll develop a strong foundation in classical and quantum mechanics, electromagnetism, statistical mechanics, thermodynamics and experimental physics. You'll gain valuable experience using modern laboratory equipment and computational tools to analyze data and solve complex problems. You will also develop expertise in critical thinking, problem solving, and quantitative analysis, and develop communication skills to convey complex ideas.
Program name: Bachelor of Science in Physics

Concentration name: Game Design and Development, Data Science
description: From designing a new app to creating a cutting-edge video game, computer science at Clarkson offers a dynamic, creative and challenging field. As a computer science major, you will learn the fundamentals of computer hardware and software design and programming while gaining a strong background in mathematics and science. Our hands-on, project-based curriculum includes opportunities to apply classroom concepts and gain practical experience. You will collaborate with faculty on research, develop innovative solutions in capstone projects, and gain invaluable industry experience through co-ops or internships. You’ll be prepared for an exciting career in software development, cybersecurity, data science, artificial intelligence, game development and more.
Accreditation status: Clarkson's Bachelor of Science in Computer Science is accredited by the Computing Accreditation Commission of ABET, www.abet.org.
Program name: Bachelor of Science in Computer Science

description: In today’s data-driven world, there’s a growing demand for skilled professionals who can extract meaningful insights from vast amounts of information. Clarkson’s Bachelor of Science in Data Science program prepares you to meet this challenge head-on, equipping you with the interdisciplinary knowledge and practical skills to thrive in this rapidly evolving field. Our curriculum gives you a strong foundation in core areas such as programming, data mining, machine learning, and statistical analysis. You’ll also have the opportunity to delve into specialized topics through electives and research projects. Through hands-on learning experiences and real-world applications, you’ll develop the critical thinking, problem-solving, and communication skills essential for success in data science careers. The Data Science program at Clarkson University is designed to equip you with a comprehensive skill set across various domains. You will develop expertise in: Data Acquisition and Management; Data Analysis and Modeling; Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence; Data Visualization and Communication; Ethical and Societal Implications of Data Science.
Program name: Bachelor of Science in Data Science
Bachelor of Science in Information Systems

description: Clarkson's rigorous bachelor's degree in software engineering provides you with the skills and knowledge to lead the design, development, testing and maintenance of complex software systems. You will gain a deep understanding of software design principles, programming languages, algorithms, data structures, and software project management. You'll learn how to develop scalable, reliable, and secure software applications, preparing you for a successful career in a rapidly evolving field. Graduates are ready to enter diverse fields like cloud computing, artificial intelligence, cybersecurity, game development, mobile application development, and software quality assurance.
Accreditation status: The Bachelor of Science in Software Engineering program is accredited by the Engineering Accreditation Commission of ABET, https://www.abet.org.
Program name: Bachelor of Science in Software Engineering

Concentration name: History of Science, Technology & Medicine; Philosophy & Ethics of Science & Technology; Science & Technology Policy; Science Communication
description: The Science Studies major (BA) provides a broad understanding of the sciences combined with the social sciences and humanities. This major allows students to choose a concentration from four areas: History of Science, Technology & Medicine; Philosophy & Ethics of Science & Technology; Science & Technology Policy; or Science Communication. It is designed to prepare students for a variety of careers in business, communication, law, government, health sciences, science writing, policy, and research. It also provides excellent preparation for graduate study in a number of fields including the history, philosophy, or sociology of science, as well as law, public policy, medicine, and business.
Program name: Bachelor of Arts in Science Studies

description: Our Environmental Toxicology program takes a multidisciplinary approach to studying how chemical and physical agents in the environment affect living organisms, including humans. This program, one of a few like it in the country, provides a unique opportunity to learn from and conduct research with faculty across the sciences. You'll gain a solid foundation in chemistry and biology, and learn to apply these principles to the study of toxicology, environmental health, and risk assessment. Students in the environmental toxicology program develop an understanding of toxic substances in the environment, the chemical, biological and physical factors influencing their behavior, and their effects on humans and other organisms. You'll also learn to: Understand the fundamental principles of toxicology and environmental health science. Identify and characterize environmental toxicants and their sources. Evaluate the toxicological effects of environmental contaminants on biological systems. Apply scientific methods and critical thinking skills to address environmental toxicology problems. Communicate scientific information effectively to diverse audiences.
Program name: Bachelor of Science in Environmental Toxicology

Bachelor of Arts in Communications

Concentration name: Communication and Culture, Digital Arts and Media
description: The Bachelor of Science in Digital Communication and Media/Multimedia, offered by Clarkson's Institute for a Sustainable Environment, prepares students for careers in the rapidly evolving fields of digital media, communication, and creative industries. This program provides a strong theoretical foundation in communication studies combined with hands-on experience in digital content creation, media production, and interactive design. Students will develop critical thinking skills, creativity, and technical proficiency essential for success in diverse roles such as content creators, digital marketers, multimedia specialists, web developers, user experience (UX) designers, and communication strategists.
Program name: Bachelor of Science in Digital Communication and Media/Multimedia

description: The Department of Humanities offers a Bachelor of Arts (BA) in History designed to provide students with a broad understanding of the past through the study of various societies, cultures, and events. This program emphasizes critical thinking, research skills, and effective communication. Students in the History program develop a strong foundation in historical methodologies and theory, preparing them for diverse career paths or further academic pursuits. Coursework covers a range of historical periods and geographical regions, allowing students to explore their interests while building a comprehensive historical perspective. Through seminar-style courses, research projects, and opportunities for internships, students gain practical experience and deepen their analytical abilities. The program fosters intellectual curiosity and encourages students to engage with complex historical questions. Graduates are well-prepared for careers in education, law, public service, archives, museums, journalism, and more. The flexible curriculum also makes it an excellent foundation for graduate studies in history, law, or related fields.
Program name: Bachelor of Arts in History

description: Our Bachelor of Science in Psychology program is STEM-focused, emphasizing critical thinking, research methods and quantitative skills. You will learn to analyze human behavior from multiple perspectives and develop the skills to apply psychological principles to solve real-world problems. Our interdisciplinary approach to the study of human behavior offers a broad and balanced curriculum, with particular strength in areas such as cognitive, developmental, social, abnormal and industrial-organizational psychology. The Psychology BS includes a required minor in data science and business. This unique combination will provide you with a comprehensive understanding of human behavior and a strong foundation in data analysis and business principles, making you highly marketable in a variety of fields. The psychology curriculum covers a wide array of topics, including social, cognitive, developmental, abnormal and industrial-organizational psychology. Courses emphasize research methods and data analysis, with opportunities for field experience and undergraduate research. This curriculum prepares you for a wide range of career paths or further graduate studies in psychology or related fields such as law, medicine or business.
Program name: Bachelor of Science in Psychology

description:
Apply modern mathematical and computational tools to solve real-world problems.
The undergraduate program in computational and applied mathematics is designed for students with strong quantitative skills who are interested in solving real-world problems using modern mathematical and computational tools. You'll gain a solid foundation in the core mathematical subjects of calculus, linear algebra and differential equations, as well as a strong background in computer programming. The curriculum also emphasizes the application of these tools to a variety of areas.
Our graduates are highly sought after by industry, especially in fields like finance, engineering and technology, where analytical thinking, problem-solving skills and mathematical modeling are essential. Our students also pursue graduate studies in applied mathematics, computational science, operations research, statistics and other related fields.
The undergraduate program in computational and applied mathematics is focused on providing students with a deep understanding of mathematical concepts and their applications, as well as the ability to use computational tools to analyze and solve complex problems. Students will learn how to:
*   Formulate mathematical models of real-world phenomena.
*   Analyze and solve these models using analytical and numerical methods.
*   Implement computational algorithms to simulate and analyze complex systems.
*   Interpret and communicate the results of their analyses effectively.
The curriculum covers a broad range of topics, including numerical analysis, optimization, differential equations, statistics, data science and machine learning. Students also have the opportunity to specialize in areas of interest through elective courses.
Program name: Bachelor of Science in Computational and Applied Mathematics
Bachelor of Science in Computer Hardware Engineering

description: With a Bachelor of Arts (BA) in Economics from Clarkson University, you will explore the fascinating world of human behavior, resource allocation, and market dynamics. This program provides a strong foundation in economic theory, quantitative methods, and critical thinking, preparing you for a wide range of career opportunities in both the public and private sectors. In the BA in economics program, you will develop a deep understanding of economic principles, learn to analyze complex data, and hone your problem-solving abilities. You will gain expertise in areas such as Microeconomics and Macroeconomics, Econometrics and Statistical Analysis, Public Policy and International Trade, Financial Markets and Behavioral Economics.
Program name: Bachelor of Arts in Economics
Bachelor of Arts in Literature
Bachelor of Arts in Social Science Research Methods

description: Environmental science is an interdisciplinary field that examines the interactions between physical, chemical and biological components of the environment and the relationships between humans and their natural environment. The environmental science minor is designed to provide students with a fundamental understanding of environmental issues, and enhance their academic and professional credentials in preparation for careers or graduate study in fields where environmental literacy is an asset.
Program name: Minor in Environmental Science
